Review Title: Best Telecommunications company to work for
Pros: The people are best, friendly, intelligent and professional. Some of the best supervisors I’ve had the privilege to work with.
Cons: Unfortunately compared to other companies they do not compensate their employees as well in salary.

Pros: - Work from home (I do have to sit at my desk being bombared by emails and busy work all day though)

Review Title: Decent Pay and Benefits but a Terrible Place to Work
Pros: Pay and benefits are decent.
Cons: 90% of the people there got the job because they are friends with someone or are related to someone that works there. So, that means no one has any experience and it is obvious. Too much playing around, talking and too much inferior work being done. Don't even think you can move up in your position because unless you are besties with someone it won't happen.

Pros: Work from home was great
Cons: They were selling at the time I left

Pros: The work is meaningful in the life and safety division. We serve the 911 community.
Cons: Compensation is not in line with industry. The company does not match your 401(k) the first year. 401(k) match is only 3%. 401(k) has seven-year vesting schedule. Must be at the company five years before reaching four weeks of vacation. First year is 10 days of vacation, year two through five is 15 days. Health insurance options are subpar. Investment options in the 401(k) are subpar. John Shlonsky leads the life and safety division and keeps every department perpetually understaffed. VPs and SVP‘s consistently fight for more staff and are constantly denied. I am a hard-working and dependable employee, but this company makes it very hard to do my job effectively.

Review Title: This company is a sleeping giant depending on how they want to invest.
Pros: Great facility for when people come back to work. Free gym, good cafeteria. Talented, friendly people still work here. Great work/life balance with  industry competitive vacation benefits. This company is a sleeping giant depending on how they want to position themselves in this industry. Great place to start a career In telephony.
Cons: Company is constantly for sale which keeps salaries low until these decisions are made. Weak 401k matching. Average medical benefits.

Pros: work from home is option
Cons: low salary compared to other companies in the area

Pros: Leadership at Intrado are awesome to work with and always put family first. WFH full time and no micro management.
Cons: Uncompetitive pay. Many people have left and are finding pay sometimes double their salary here at Intrado. We hear promises this will change for the past 3+ years and have yet to see it.

Review Title: Great team at a disorganized company
Pros:
- Great people to work with. Cannot say enough good things about my direct manager and coworkers.
- Always learning new technologies. Keeping busy with so many aspects of the development process from coding to CI-CD and to cloud technologies.
Cons:
- Pay rate lower than market average.
- Benefits, 401k are sub par compared to other companies.
- Poor equipment budget. Current laptop has an old i5 processor with only 8 GB of RAM. Not enough to do my job when running Office 365, Teams, Webex, Docker, VSCode, and everything else.
- Very uncertain future. Intrado is in the process of dividing the company up and selling the pieces. 
- Very poor inter-department communication. There is too many migrations happening at once and things are starting to collide into each other which is blocking entire dev teams. 
- On Call. This is probably the worst aspect. Expect to get called late at least once or twice if you're on call for the week. Some weeks are better than others, but things seem to break too often.

Pros: the only pro is remote working
Cons:
I left Intrado taking a position that paid less than my position with Intrado and was not remote. That should be enough said. 
It really is toxic environment where you will experience multiple types of bullying, yes, I said bullying. It can happen even in remote working situations. Specifically, the types of obnoxious behavior I experienced came in three forms. The saboteur is the person who undermines your every move letting you how terrible you are to the others, and strongly associated to that is gatekeeper bully who misdirects you and with hold resources preventing you from becoming more proficient in your duties. 
Finally, the constant critic, will be somebody in management, talking down to you and picking apart your work. I was not with the company exceptionally long, slightly over a year, in that time a dozen people left their positions with the company.

Pros: They are Always hiring and the process is quick.
Cons: The company seemed unorganized and they didn't hire qualified professionals dor the job they wanted completed.

Pros: Great company, great culture, great management, a ton of collaboration, and great work-life balance.
Cons: Every year the roles change which can be draining

Pros: Remote for most employees in 1022
Cons: Company mgmt change and higher quotas with higher costs for benefits hit the reps hard

Pros: The people were nice and I liked my manager. Metrics were transparent, and there were some opportunities for advancement.
Cons: The hours were not ideal, and the job was redundant and boring. Management wasn't able to solve our biggest problems.

Pros: Management provided autonomy. Saas is a complex but interesting platform.
Cons: Senior leadership cares more for profits than people or morale. Several restructures and layoffs due improper vetting and negligence. Constantly rebranding name and image.

Pros: --great community of coworkers and lower managers ( not a lot of contact with upper management) --lower management is very understanding and used to work in the editorial analyst position (inside hire/promotion) --During non-earnings periods, the work is sometimes slow paced and a bit more relaxed --Don't often have to work overtime or odd hours outside of schedule
Cons: --During earnings periods, the work can be VERY fast paced, which gets a little stressful --The hours are very inflexible since they need 24/7 coverage --They prefer new hires to work the evening shift which isn't so great

Pros: I feel the benefits are good with a decent match on 401K and the paid vacation is more than many companies. My direct supervisor is fantastic and my team of co-workers are great to work with. I enjoy my current role in the company and look forward to coming to work on a daily basis.
Cons: I feel that Intrado Life & Safety does not try to retain talented individuals in a niche market where I believe employee retention is very important because ramp up times to be self sufficient in many of the roles require 6 months or more on the job. Also I feel the large pay bands that overlap positions leave little incentive to try to obtain promotions as most employees that I know of have received a 5% or less for a significant increase in job responsibilities with the promotion. The pay should be according to the job responsibilities, not a small percentage increase on what the employee was previously making. Many positions lack upward mobility/advancement and switching departments within the company is the only way to advance. I also think that this company at the current moment is not offering competitive salaries. I know that I could leave and have a higher offer by at least $20,000.

Pros:
role: website service manager for investor relations clients.
- nice coworkers, knowledgeable
- specified work shifts. you put your OOO message up when your shift end. client have the choice to email the after-hour team to complete their website updates.
Cons:
felt like the interview process did not shed light into some job nuances that are important factors to consider for anyone thinking of accepting this job.

- you have to sign onto a phone line. it's like a call center where clients can call in to request website updates.
- you have to clock in your time. for each client request, you need to record it.
- a book of 60-70 clients.
- ops role but you do account management meetings with clients.
- for vacation, you have to find a coworker who will cover all your clients in order for you to take time off. so place nice and make friends.
- you have to find a coworker to cover you if you ever need to call in sick.
- you need to schedule virtual webcasting events for your clients.
- project management all website updates and virtual event deliverables.
- org is pretty flat. you can become a senior website service manager, then manager to a team.
- 90% of coworkers have been there 8+ years.

Pros: I am proud of the fact that what I do can help to save a life at any given time. Intrado has good benefits overall. Working from home has rocked, even if it was for a bad reason, and talk of continuing at least a modified version is promising.
Cons: Due to RIFs and attrition there are less people doing the same amount of work in some areas and it can be frustrating and exhausting. Creates the feeling of not being able to take time off because someone else could be overwhelmed with the work load. I don't think the compensation is where it should be to compare/compete on a national scale for the "entry" level positions and it makes it harder for Intrado to hire quality people.

Pros: Ability to learn many different aspects of Telecom Engineering
Cons: No down sides working for Intrado

Pros: People are amazing and smart.
Cons: FCC, the regulating entity, is awful.

Pros: No Micromanaging. Coworkers are mostly cordial.
Cons: They provide minimal training so when they put you on the phone you're mostly on your own to try and figure out what to do or where to go.

Review Title: It continues to get worse and worse
Pros: Direct manager was great. Lots of freedom as long as you get your work done. Industry leading time off (for now). Those with talent are promoted. Almost everyone outside of corporate West are great people that really care.
Cons: I worked at Intrado for about 8 years. In that amount of time I struggle to come up with a single thing that has improved. Ever since West and Apollo took over they have slowly bled the company dry. 401k basically cut in half, PTO rebranded as vacation/sick so they don't have to pay it out when you quit or get laid off. Consistent layoffs to teams that are already extremely short staffed. There is a huge disconnect between folks working in the Longmont office and corporate. Corporate acts as overlords and we were all just along for the ride. Pay is laughably low considering being located in one of the most expensive counties in the country. It's a shame that West/Apollo has turned legacy Intrado into what it is today. People quitting in bunches and for good reason. Lots more hanging on, hoping that an eventual sale will make things better.

Pros: There is no good reason to work here.
Cons: This company is run by a network of good 'ol boys. Every decision they make is based on nepotism or some personal nonsense. The company was founded by an unindicted co-conspirator in the biggest accounting fraud case in US history. That is very clearly reflected in their culture. This is a company that will lie directly to your face about everything. It's currently going into a firesale, because the good 'ol boys have completely and utterly failed in trying to modernize any of their company. It's being parted out and sold for scrap like a stolen car. The management is also full of absolutely creepy men who try creep on younger women. The pay is garbage and the culture is somehow worse.

Pros: No Pro's for this environment
Cons:
- One of the lowest Paid place to work in this field
- Leadership 
- Micromanagement 
-No carrier path
- Uncertain future with company and due to being stripped apart to be sold.
- No longer Support structure but has turned into a call center to pass the work around and the customer cannot get help in a timely manner.

Pros: Work from home, mostly great coworkers
Cons: Commission structure needs a lot of work, company culture is top down, lack of room for growth

Pros: This is one of the few companies where, from the recruiter to the coworkers, everyone really welcomes you and becomes very accessible to you. From tracking your equipment to helping you learn everything and get you ready to go: if you want support, assistance and guidance, you will have it. The work is surprisingly fun to do, but mostly it fills you with pride knowing that your voice is what guide so many people who reach out for help.
Cons: Working with a desktop computer instead of a laptop with remote connection! I am an avid overseas travel, and now I'm (literally!!) stuck at home because of lack of mobility, which has not been the case with previous companies for which I worked over the past 16 years. Being that this is a communications company, mobility is their second nature = this capacity should also be extended to their employees. In this day and age, it's probably forbidden to consider not to be able work from a laptop. I look forward to be able to either receive/trade my work desktop for a laptop so that I can resume my overseas travels while I continue doing my work, just as I have done for so many years.

Pros: John get to eat steak dinner in his mansion every night for the sake of laying off employees!
Cons: A complete S*** Show with top heavy managers who can’t manage!

Review Title: Fantastic company and great group to work with!
Pros: Intrado has impressed me since day one. They deliver any tool you can possibly need for your own success. They are incredibly customer driven and passionate about being the leaders in the industry. There is an immense amount of growth opportunity for your own career. Management goes above and beyond to see their folks grow and succeed.
Cons: There have been many acquisitions which is amazing for growth but it can be challenging when creating/updating internal processes.

Review Title: Genuine, positive culture and fast-paced (mostly), interesting work
Pros: The recipe for a great place to work always starts and ends with culture. At Intrado Digital Media, which recently rebranded as Notified, it's overwhelmingly, overflowingly encouraging and positive. 90 days in and I truly feel that I can be here at least 3 years (and even more, of course), primarily because of how I feel about the support of my supervisor, other leads and colleagues. There's positive vibes all around, and the work itself ... well, it's definitely for the editorially minded who hate typos and assorted mistakes in press releases. I also personally enjoy speaking with clients, and the volume of the calls is not like call centers, so the balance of editing and answering phones/making calls/sending emails is ideal.
Cons: For anyone coming from reporting or editing where the *byline* mattered, this is a different kind of shop. However, that's a trade-off I don't mind when factoring in job security, and competitive pay.

Pros: Good environment for career growth
Cons: Stressful each and every day for

Review Title: Raises of 1-3% for six years, Expensive Benefits, Unorganized Management
Pros:
I loved my job, but it was very niche.
Great at providing cookies for holidays, but went from elaborate company parties (no bonuses) to team celebrations to no celebrations in just a few years.
Cons:
Management decided to switch up the sales so that one division's Account Managers were suddenly selling another division's products and vice-versa. There was no training for the individual managers and they had no idea what they were doing. This was a disaster for both customers and support personnel.
Extremely expensive benefits.
Poor support. I know of one senior level manager who would walk around each morning and say something to all of his reports that he had something in common with (schools, churches, family members) and literally walk past other employees without saying hello.
Poor raises. Averaged 1-3%. 
Company required managers to find something to rate employees down on during yearly reviews. Even if employees were stellar in all of their responsibilities, they could not get an excellent review.
For some reason, the managers encouraged teams to work within themselves and not reach out to other employees with expertise that could be provided. Set up rivalries.

Pros: good people that work therre
Cons: Lots of overtime and lots of over work

Pros: Very well organized. Firm continually seeking feedback from team members with an emphasis on improvement.
Cons: Thus far, everything has gone quite well.

Pros: Remote and didn't get a micro management feel.
Cons: Company was in the process of laying of multiple positions including mine.

Pros: Friendly atmosphere Great Culture Always someone to help with needs
Cons: Miss seeing people in the office

Review Title: Life & Safety has a bright future
Pros:
Intrado has multiple divisions. One of those is where I work, Life & Safety where we operate and improve the nations first responder network. Its quite a mission, I am proud of. Stressful at times when we know what is at stake but rewarding.

Lots of new innovations since our new President came on board (he's kinda like the energizer bunny), however, with a little more investment these could not only improve safety they could be good business. I like that we are trying new things again.
Cons:
Layers of senior management at a corporate level. Sometimes it feels like our division cannot make important decisions or the decision making process is always changing.

The Life & Safety business seems to be very profitable, but it feels like that profit is used to help underperforming divisions, that made poor product and business decisions over the years.

Pros: Nobody cares where you are or what you're doing. Ever.
Cons: There is literally zero chance of advancing your career or doing anything other than the one job you were hired for. Doing anything outside the box gets an immediate "Mind your business" in reply. Intrado pays the absolute lowest market viable salary. Your computer will be worth less than $200. You'll have to quit and go somewhere else in order to get a pay raise or promotion.

Pros: I dont know of many pros for the overall company. However, before we were forced to integrate from an acquisition, everyone in our line of business was happy, cheerful, loved their job and coming to work. It was always great to see everyone trying to do right by the customer.
Cons: This company doesn't know customer service. They do NOT care about their employees or their well being. They fire staff with no regard and pile work onto people that end up having to wear so many hats it ultimately burns them out. The private equity firm that runs the place has no sense of direction, just maximize funds, ribbing Peter to pay Paul, and basically firing everyone because they aren't creative at all. Since all the original sales and product folks bailed or were RiF'd not one person cares to pick up the reigns and provide some direction. Best case scenario is someone in the business purchases the line of business to save what little is left of an almost 30yr old company.

Pros: Intrado is a good place to work. Benefits are competitive and the PTO is in line with other companies.
Cons: Severely understaffed in technical resources.

Pros: Good team, good management, relax work environment
Cons: Detail time sheet entry is kind of hassle

Pros: Good Leadership and management so far
Cons: onboarding was a bit shaky with getting into all of the sytems

Pros: Benefits are reasonable, 401k fair, and vacation pay standard. Limited holiday pay.
Cons: Intrado/West was highly successful for many years but unfortunately when Apollo acquired Intrado/West the ship began sinking under the new leadership. Intrado/West employees were treated well prior to the acquisition and bonus incentives were offered based on your contribution to the bottom line. Once Apollo took leadership the financial greed overshadowed the positive environment and poor business decisions were made that created a significant loss in clients. As clients began leaving the employees saw the writing on the wall and the talent left in droves. Mass layoffs began taking place because of the client revenue loss and it continues to be a downward spiral.

Pros:
Everything is very good as the staff is understanding and co-operate with all their executives.
The value of time and other business/professional etiquette are there in the whole environment. 
All the staff members, trainers, and managers are supportive and helpful in every situation.
Overall a very good place/platform to work.
Cons: Haven't been rectified yet and I am sure it will be not ever rectified as the whole staff is cool and are professionals.

Review Title: Positive supportive work environment but business is going down
Pros:
Positive environment 
Great colleagues 
Not too stressful of a job
Not very customer facing rolw
Learned new skills
Pay was good. 
Only 3 weeks vacation
Gret work life balance. Rarely worked overtime
Cons:
They just fired a large amount of people because sales were down.
They're currently transferring to a new platform to try to stay competitive but the transition and training plan was very poor. 
Unclear where the company is going or what the new job is going to be.

Pros: Consistent paycheck and Cool coworkers.
Cons: Technicians get the most of the work and get the least pay. Company has been sold and has become completely corporate. They only look at numbers in paper and don’t look at the scope of work that is necessary on the technicians end. Technicians are micro managed while other teams who do less work and get paid more get excuses made for them. If you’re a good employee they continue to pile work on you while mediocre employees get a pass. They will use the “you’re so great at this” as an excuse and want you to take a compliment meanwhile they don’t compensate with money. Compliments do not pay bills, it’s not a compliment. It’s insulting.

Review Title: Neutral leaning towards negative but could have changed.
Pros: The PTO used to be given all at once on your annual review and it was a decent amount. That was the only pro of working there. After they were bought out or went into bankruptcy, however they want to term it, that was one of the first benefits they did away with when it was the only decent benefit they had.
Cons: Absolutely terrible oncall and work to life balance, previous coworkers have said this has improved. Also when I left the insurance was barely better than going to the marketplace independently to get insurance on your own.

Review Title: My honest, two cents for those who read this..
Pros:
Great strategic partnerships for reselling UCaaS. 
Good work life balance.
Most employees "left" truly care about our clients. 
Manager is easy to work with and helpful.
Leadership cares and wants the team to win.
Cons:
Internal red tape prevents things from getting done in a timely manner.
Training on new solutions is a one hour session and needs to in smaller groups vs all hands on deck sessions.
Internal procedures and processes change frequently making it difficult to get simple tasks accomplished.
Could align internal departments and open more communications between teams.
